text: The William Gray House (also known as the G. H. Simpson House) is a historic house located at 407 Washington Street in La Grange, Lewis County, Missouri. == Description and history == It was built in about 1860, and is a two-story, three bay wide, side hall plan, brick I-house with Greek Revival style design elements. It has a long one-story brick rear ell and a one-story front porch that surrounds the main entrance. (includes 12 photographs from 1998) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places on June 3, 1999. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Greek Revival houses in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1860 Category:Buildings and structures in Lewis County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Lewis County, Missouri Category:1860 establishments in Missouri Category:I-houses in Missouri
title: William Gray House
